gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour
Class ContourJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Transforms.CoordJPanel
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.ContourJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ContourJPanel
extends CoordJPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, IPreserveState

This class is a special type of JPanel that has the ability to draw a contour plot that describes an IVirtualArray2D of data.

With drawing the contour lines, you can:

  • Specify the contours levels to render
  • Specify the contour colors
  • Specify the contour styles
  • Specify if the contour lines should be labeled
  • If the contour lines are labeled, specify the number of significant figures reflected in the labels
  • Specify the contour plot's background color
  • Acquire a thumbnail image of the main contour plot
  • Specify that the plot should be drawn with the aspect ratio preserved or not preserved
  • Zoom in on a region of the plot

This class is designed such that there are getter/setter methods to get and set properties that modify the way the contour plot is rendered. Except when specified otherwise, these setter methods don't immediately re-render the contour plot. Instead, after invoking a setter method, the reRender() method should be invoked to re-render the contour plot. This improves efficiency because several properties can be set and then the contour plot can be re-rendered one time to reflect all of the changed properties (instead of re-rendering the contour plot several times for each changed property).

This class caches the thumbnail it creates. Thus, when the thumbnail is requested (with the getThumbnail(int, int) method), a new thumbnail is not redrawn if the cached copy accurately reflects the main contour plot. This improves performance. To force the thumbnail to be redrawn (i.e. to specify that the thumbnail does not accurately reflect the main contour plot), the invalidateThumbnail() method can be invoked before requesting the thumbnail. However, after any of the setter methods are used to change the way the contour plot is drawn, the invalidateThumbnail() should not be invoked. Instead, the setter methods will invalidate the thumbnail if it needs to be (sometimes the thumbnail is still valid after setting a property).

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

CONTOURS_KEY

public static final java.lang.String CONTOURS_KEY
"Contours" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing the state information of the Contours object which encapsulates the contour levels that this class renders. The value that this key references is an ObjectState of a Contours object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LINE_STYLES_KEY

public static final java.lang.String LINE_STYLES_KEY
"Line styles" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing the which line styles are used when rendering the contour levels. The value that this key references is an int array where each integer is a code specifying a line style.

If styleArr is a reference to the array of line styles, then the ith contour line is rendered with the line style specified by element at index i%(styleArr.length) in the array.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SHOW_LABEL_KEY

public static final java.lang.String SHOW_LABEL_KEY
"Show labels" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing which contour labels are given labels as they are rendered. The value that this key references is a boolean array. Each element in the array is either true if the label should be displayed and false if it shouldn't be.

If labelArr is a reference to the array specifying which contour lines have labels, then the ith contour line is given a label if the element in the array at index i%(labelArr.length) is true. If the element is false, the contour level is not given a label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NUM_SIG_FIGS_KEY

public static final java.lang.String NUM_SIG_FIGS_KEY
"Num of significant figures" - This static constant String is a key used for referencing the number of significant figures that that the contour labels are rounded to. The value that this key references is an integer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constructor Detail

ContourJPanel

public ContourJPanel(IVirtualArray2D data2D,
                     float minValue,
                     float maxValue,
                     int numLevels)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs the panel such that it uses the data specified in data2D and uses contours based on minValue, maxValue, and numLevels.

Parameters:
data2D - The IVirtualArray2D whose data is plotted.
minValue - The value of the data about which the first contour will be created.
maxValue - The value of the data about which the last controu will be created.
numLevels - The number of gaps between the contours. Thus, there will be numLevels+1 contours where the first one has value minValue and the (numLevels+1)nth one has the value maxValue.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - iff data2D is null or numLevels<=0 or minValue>maxValue,

ContourJPanel

public ContourJPanel(IVirtualArray2D data2D,
                     float[] levels)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs the panel such that it uses the data specified in data2D and draws the data around the contours specified.

Parameters:
data2D - The IVirtualArray2D whose data is plotted.
levels - The values of the contours to use.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - iff data2D is null or levels is null or levels.length<=0.
Method Detail

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state information for this contour image plotter. The state information contains information such as which contour lines are drawn, their line styles, which lines have labels, the number of significant figures displayed on the labels, etc. These properties can be accessed by keys which are the public static final String fields of this class.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
getObjectState in class CoordJPanel
Parameters:
isDefault - If true the default state of this contour plotter is returned. If false the current state is returned.
Returns:
The state of this contour plotter.

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to set the state of this contour plotter. The state contains information such as which contour lines are drawn, their line styles, which lines have labels, the number of significant figures displayed on the labels, etc. These settings can be set using keys which are the public static final String fields of this class.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
setObjectState in class CoordJPanel
Parameters:
state - An encapsulation of the state information for this contour plotter.

getLineStyles

public int[] getLineStyles()
Used to get the line styles that a given contour line is rendered as. The first contour line rendered uses the line style of the first element of the array returned. The second line uses the second element of the array etc. When the end of the array is reached, reading starts over from the start of the array.

Returns:
An array of integers each designating a line style
See Also:
SOLID, DASHED, DASHED_DOTTED, DOTTED

The second line uses the second element of the array etc. When the end of the array is reached, reading starts over from the start of the array.

Parameters:
lineStyles - An array of integers each designating a line style

getShowLabels

public boolean[] getShowLabels()
Used to determine which contour lines have labels rendered. The first contour line rendered uses labels if and only if the first element in the array returned is 'true'. The second contour line uses the second element in the array etc. When the end of the array is reached, reading starts over from the start of the array.

Returns:
The array of booleans which describe which contour lines are drawn with labels.

setShowLabels

public void setShowLabels(boolean[] showLabels)
Used to set which contour lines have labels rendered. The first contour line rendered uses labels if and only if the first element in the array given is 'true'. The second contour line uses the second element in the array etc. When the end of the array is reached, reading starts over from the start of the array.

Parameters:
showLabels - The array of booleans which describe which contour lines are drawn with labels.

setShowAllLabels

public void setShowAllLabels(boolean b)
Used to specify if all or none of the contour levels are rendered with their labels drawn.

Parameters:
b - True if all contour levels should be rendered with their labels drawn and false if none of the contour levels should be rendered with their labels drawn.

setShowLabelEvery

public void setShowLabelEvery(int num)
Used to specify that a uniform sequence of contour lines should have their labels drawn. In other words, if contour line 1 is the first contour line drawn, then the contour lines, 1, 1+num, 1+2*num, 1+3*num, .... are the only lines drawn with labels.

Parameters:
num - Specifies the multiple of the contour lines that are drawn with labels.

getNumSigDigits

public int[] getNumSigDigits()
Used to get the number of significant figures that the contour levels are rounded to.

Returns:
The first contour level rendered has its label rounded to the number of figures as specified by the first element in this array. The second contour level similarly uses the second element of this array etc. When, the end of the array is reached, reading starts over at the start of the array. Note: A nonpositive number designates that the contour labels should not be formatted.

setNumSigDigits

public void setNumSigDigits(int[] numSigDigs)
Used to set the number of significant figures a contour label is rounded to. When the contours are rendered, the first contour drawn uses the number of significant figures as specified by the first value in this array. The next contour rendered uses the second element in the array etc. When, the end of the array is reached, the contour starts over using the start of the array.

Note: In the array, a nonpositive number designates that the label should not be formatted. Otherwise, a positive number designates that the label should be formatted to the specified number of significant figures.

Parameters:
numSigDigs - Holds the number of significant digits used when rendering the contour's labels.

setNumSigDigits

public void setNumSigDigits(int numSigDigs)
Used to set all of the contour levels to render their labels using the specified number of significant figures.

Parameters:
numSigDigs - The number of significant figures that each contour label is rounded to. A nonpositive number designates that the contour levels should not have their labels formatted.

getColorScale

public java.awt.Color[] getColorScale()
Contour levels can be drawn using different colors depending on their "elevation". This method returns the colors used to determine the colors to use for an elevation.

Returns:
The array of colors used to determine what color to draw the contour lines. The contour line of lowest elevation is drawn using the color specified by the first element of this array. The contour line of highest elevation is drawn using the color specified by the last element of this array.

setColorScale

public void setColorScale(java.lang.String scaleType,
                          boolean doubleSided)
Contour levels can be drawn using different colors depending on their "elevation". This method is used to set the scale used to determine which color to render a contour line with.

Parameters:
scaleType - A String describing the range of colors to use. This String must be one of the fields from the IndexColorMaker class.
doubleSided - If true negative and positive "elevations" will be drawn with different colors. If false, a negative "elevation" will be drawn with the same color as its positive version.

setColorScale

public void setColorScale(java.awt.Color[] colors)
Contour levels can be drawn using different colors depending on their "elevation". This method is used to set the scale used to determine which color to render a contour level with.

Parameters:
colors - The array of colors used to determine which color to render a contour level with. The lowest contour level is drawn using the color specified by the first element of this array. The highest contour level is drawn using the color specified by the last element of this array. The other elevations are colored using the elements between the first and last elements in the array.

setColorScale

public void setColorScale(java.awt.Color color)
Used to specify that all of the contour lines should be drawn using the same line color.

Parameters:
color - The line color used when drawing the contour lines.

getBackgroundColor

public java.awt.Color getBackgroundColor()
Used to get the background color drawn behind all of the contor levels.

Returns:
This panel's background color.

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color color)
Used to set the background color drawn behind all of the contour levels.

Parameters:
color - This panel's new background color.

getLogScale

public double getLogScale()
Used to get the logscale factor that is used in the logarithmic mapping that is used to determine the color of the contour lines as they are drawn.

Returns:
The factor that describes how closely the contour levels are mapped to the max value (if the logscale is close to 100), or how closely the contour levels are mapped to the min value (if the logscale is close to 0).

setLogScale

public void setLogScale(double logScale)
Used to set the logscale factor that is used in the logarithmic mapping that is used to determine the color of the contour lines as they are drawn.

Parameters:
logScale - The factor that describes how closely the contour levels are mapped to the max value (if 'logScale' is close to 100), or how closely the contour levels are mapped to the min value (if 'logScale' is close to 0).

getData

public IVirtualArray2D getData()
Used to get a reference to the data onto which the contour lines being drawn are based.

Returns:
A reference to the IVirtualArray2D that this ContourJPanel is using.

getRowForY

public int getRowForY(float y)
Used to determine the row in the virtual array of data that contains the data point that is displayed at the pixel point with the given y coordinate.

Parameters:
y - The y coordinate of the pixel point in question.
Returns:
The row in the virtual array that corresponds to the given pixel point's y coordinate.

getColumnForX

public int getColumnForX(float x)
Used to determine the column in the virtual array of data that contains the data point that is displayed at the pixel point with the given x coordinate.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pixel point in question.
Returns:
The column in the virtual array that corresponds to the given pixel point's x coordinate.

getThumbnail

public java.awt.Image getThumbnail(int width,
                                   int height)
Used to get a thumbnail image of the main contour plot image. This method caches the thumbnail and only rerenders a new one if the contour plot has changed. Thus, if the contour image isn't being modified (by changing the colorscale, line styles, etc.) this method can be called often without a large performance hit.

Parameters:
width - Specifies the width of the thumbnail.
height - Specifies the height of the thumbnail.
Returns:
A thumbnail image that reflects the main contour plot image.

changeData

public void changeData(IVirtualArray2D arr)
Use this method to change the data that is being displayed on the contour graph. This method then redraws the graph to reflect the new data.

Parameters:
arr - The new data that should be plotted.

invalidateThumbnail

public void invalidateThumbnail()
Used to make the cached thumbnail invalid. As a result, when the getThumbnail(int, int) method is invoked, the thumbnail is forced to be redrawn.

reRender

public void reRender()
Used to force the contour graph to be redrawn.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics gr)
Does the actual work of painting the contour lines on the panel.
